themes.label: Stele
themes.rationale: The text explicitly mentions the setting up of the record on the Acropolis, which was typically done on a stone stele.

themes.label: Marble
themes.rationale: Athenian public decrees of this period were almost exclusively inscribed on marble slabs.

rationale: This is an Athenian decree from the archonship of Theodotus (387/6 BCE). It concerns the administrative and legal status of Athenian cleruchs (settlers) on the island of Lemnos. The text outlines religious duties (sacrifices to the Twelve Gods), financial regulations (leasing of confiscated property), and legal procedures for disputes involving the settlers. It references the treatment of settlers on Salamis as a precedent and specifies that the decree be erected on the Acropolis.
